algorithms.name: return the Sec-CH-UA value for a request
algorithms.html: To return the Sec-CH-UA value for a request, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let brands be the result of running create brands with "significant version".
Let list be the result of creating a brand-version list, with brands and "significant version".
Return the output of running serializing a list with list.

algorithms.name: return the Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version-List value for a request
algorithms.html: To return the Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version-List value for a request, perform the following steps:

steps.html: Let brands be the result of running create brands with "full version".
Let list be the result of create a brand-version list, with brands and "full version".
Return the output of running serializing a list with list as input.

algorithms.name: get the platform version
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="get-the-platform-version" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">get the platform version</dfn>, given a string <var>platform</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html: If <var>platform</var> is either "Linux" or "Fuchsia":
Return the empty string.
If <var>platform</var> is "Android":
Let platformReturnedVersionString be the result of querying the OS’s android.os.Build.VERSION.RELEASE string.
Return the result of creating a unified platform version string with platformReturnedVersionString.
If <var>platform</var> is "iOS":
Let platformReturnedVersionString be the result of querying the UIDevice object returned by currentDevice and reading its systemVersion.
Return the result of creating a unified platform version string with platformReturnedVersionString.
If <var>platform</var> is "Windows":

If available (i.e., on Windows 10 or higher), let platformReturnedVersionString be the result of querying the Windows.Foundation.UniversalApiContract integer version and converting it to a string. Otherwise, let platformReturnedVersionString be the result of getting the legacy Windows version number.
Return the result of creating a unified platform version string with platformReturnedVersionString.
Let platformVersionComponentList be a list.
If <var>platform</var> is "macOS":
Let macOSVersion be the operatingSystemVersion property of the NSProcessInfo object returned by getting the processInfo information agent.
Append macOSVersion’s majorVersion, minorVersion, and patchVersion components (in that order) to platformVersionComponentList.
If <var>platform</var> is some other value:
Append one to three version parts based on the format most likely to lead to interoperability with other browsers running on platform to platformVersionComponentList.
While platformVersionComponentList’s length is less than 3, append "0" to platformVersionComponentList.
Return the result of the concatenation of platformVersionComponentList with a U+002E FULL STOP (.) separator.

algorithms.name: get the legacy Windows version number
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="get-the-legacy-windows-version-number" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">get the legacy Windows version number</dfn>, run the following steps:

steps.html: Let major be the value of OSVERSIONINFO’s dwMajorVersion member returned from the Win32 GetVersionEx API.
Let minor be the value of OSVERSIONINFO’s dwMinorVersion member returned from the Win32 GetVersionEx API.
If major is 6 and minor is 3 (i.e., Windows 8.1), return "0.3".
If major is 6 and minor is 2 (i.e., Windows 8), return "0.2".
If major is 6 and minor is 1 (i.e., Windows 7), return "0.1".
Otherwise, return "0".

algorithms.name: create a unified platform version string
algorithms.html:
To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-a-unified-platform-version-string" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create a unified platform version string</dfn>, given a string <var>input</var>, run the following
steps:

steps.html: Let platformVersionComponentList be a list and index be 0.
Let platformVersionUnprocessedTokenList be the list returned by strictly splitting input on the U+002E FULL STOP character (.):
While <var>index</var> is less than 3:
If <var>index</var> is less than the length of <var>platformVersionUnprocessedTokenList</var>:
If platformVersionUnprocessedTokenList[index] is an unsigned integer, convert it to a string and append it to platformVersionComponentList.
Otherwise, append "0" to platformVersionComponentList.

Otherwise, if <var>index</var> is greater than or equal to the length of
<var>platformVersionUnprocessedTokenList</var>:
Append "0" to platformVersionComponentList.
Increment index by 1.
Return the result of the concatenation of platformVersionComponentList with a U+002E FULL STOP (.) separator.

algorithms.name: create brands
algorithms.html: When asked to <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-brands" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create brands</dfn> with <var>version type</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html: Let list be a list.
Assert version type is either "full version" or "significant version".
For each brand that represents the user agent—or an equivalence class—as brand:
Let version be a string, initialized accordingly:
If version type is "full version", set version to a string that corresponds to the full version.
If version type is "significant version", set version to a string that corresponds to the significant version.
Let dict be a new NavigatorUABrandVersion dictionary, with brand set to brand and version set to version.
Append dict to list.
The user agent SHOULD execute the following steps:

Append one additional item to list containing a NavigatorUABrandVersion dictionary, initialized with brand set to arbitrary brand and set version to the result of create an arbitrary version with version type.
Randomize the order of the items in list.
Return list.

algorithms.name: create an arbitrary brand
algorithms.html: To create an arbitrary brand, the user agent MUST run these steps:

steps.html: Let arbitraryBrand be a string composed of ASCII alpha and 0x20 (SP). arbitraryBrand MUST contain one or more 0x20 (SP) bytes and be no longer than twenty ASCII bytes, and MUST not start or end with 0x20 (SP).
Let arbitraryBrandList be the result of splitting arbitraryBrand on ASCII whitespace.
Let greaseyStack be a stack.
Let greaseyChars be the list of ASCII bytes « 0x20 (SP), 0x28 (left parenthesis), 0x29 (right parenthesis), 0x2D (-), 0x2E (.), 0x2F (/), 0x3A (:), 0x3B (;), 0x3D (=), 0x3F (?), 0x5F (_) ».
Let index be 0.
While index is less than the size of arbitraryBrandList minus one:
Push a randomly selected item from greaseyChars onto greaseyStack.
Increment index by 1.
Let greaseyBrandList be a list and set index to 0.
While greaseyStack is not empty:
Append arbitraryBrandList[index] to greaseyBrandList.
Let item be the result of popping from greaseyStack.
Append item to greaseyBrandList.
Increment index by 1.
Append arbitraryBrandList[index] to greaseyBrandList.
Return the result of stripping leading and trailing ASCII whitespace from the concatenation of greaseyBrandList (with no separator).

algorithms.name: create an arbitrary version
algorithms.html: To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-an-arbitrary-version" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create an arbitrary version</dfn> given <var>version type</var>, run the following steps:

steps.html: Assert version type is either "full version" or "significant version".
Let arbitrary version be a string, initialized accordingly:
If version type is "full version", set arbitrary version to a string that matches the format of the full version, but not the value.
If version type is "significant version", set arbitrary version to a string that matches the format of significant version, but not the value.
Return arbitrary version.

algorithms.name: create a brand-version list
algorithms.html:
To <dfn class="dfn-paneled has-dfn-panel" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-noexport="" id="create-a-brand-version-list" role="button" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0">create a brand-version list</dfn> given <var>brands</var> and <var>version type</var>, perform the following
steps:

steps.html: Let list be a list, initially empty.
Assert version type is either "full version" or "significant version".
For each <var>brand</var> in <var>brands</var>:
Let <var>version</var> be a string, initialized accordingly:
If version type is "full version", set version to a string that corresponds to the full version.
If version type is "significant version", set version to a string that corresponds to the significant version.
Let parameter be a dictionary, initially empty.
Set parameter["param_key"] to "v".
Set parameter["param_value"] to version.
Let pair be a tuple comprised of brand’s brand and parameter.
Append pair to list.
Return list.

algorithms.name: NavigatorUA/getHighEntropyValues(hints)
algorithms.html: The getHighEntropyValues(hints) method MUST run these steps:

steps.html: Let p be a a new promise created in the current realm.
Let uaData be a new UADataValues.
set uaData["brands"] to this’s relevant global object’s brands frozen array.
set uaData["mobile"] to the user agent’s mobileness.
set uaData["platform"] to the user agent’s platform brand.
If this’s relevant global object’s associated Document is not allowed to use the ch-ua-high-entropy-values feature, resolve p with uaData.
Otherwise, run the following steps in parallel:
If hints contains "architecture", set uaData["architecture"] to the user agent’s platform architecture.
If hints contains "bitness", set uaData["bitness"] to the user agent’s platform bitness.
If hints contains "formFactors", set uaData["formFactors"] to the user agent’s form-factors.
If hints contains "fullVersionList", set uaData["fullVersionList"] to this’s relevant global object’s full version list frozen array.
If hints contains "model", set uaData["model"] to the user agent’s model.
If hints contains "platformVersion", set uaData["platformVersion"] to the result of getting the platform version with platform brand.
If hints contains "uaFullVersion", set uaData["uaFullVersion"]
If hints contains "wow64", set uaData["wow64"] to the user agent’s wow64-ness.
Queue a task on the permission task source to resolve p with uaData.
Return p.

algorithms.name: NavigatorUA/toJSON()
algorithms.html: The toJSON() method MUST run these steps:

steps.html: Let uaLowEntropyData be a new UALowEntropyJSON
Set uaLowEntropyData["brands"] to this’s relevant global object’s brands frozen array.
Set uaLowEntropyData["mobile"] to the user agent’s mobileness.
Set uaLowEntropyData["platform"] to the user agent’s platform brand.
Return uaLowEntropyData

algorithms.name: emulated UA Client Hints
algorithms.html: The emulated UA Client Hints associated with environment settings object environment settings, are the result of running the following steps:

steps.html: Let related navigables be the result of get related navigables with environment settings.
For each <var>navigable</var> or <var>related navigables</var>:
Let top-level navigable be navigable’s top-level traversable.
Let user context be top-level navigable’s associated user context.
If emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per navigables contains top-level navigable, return emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per navigables[top-level navigable].
If emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per user contexts contains user context, return emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per user contexts[user context].
Let default emulated client hints be emulated client hints’s default emulated client hints.
If default emulated client hints is not null, return default emulated client hints.
Return null.

algorithms.name: remote end steps for emulation.setClientHintsOverride
algorithms.html: The remote end steps given command parameters are:

steps.html: If command parameters contains "userContexts" and command parameters contains "contexts", return error with error code invalid argument.
Let emulated client hints be command parameters["clientHints"].
If command parameters contains "contexts":
Let navigables be the result of trying to get valid top-level traversables by ids with command parameters["contexts"].
For each <var>navigable</var> of <var>navigables</var>:
If emulated client hints is null, remove navigable emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per navigables.
Otherwise, set emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per navigables[navigable] to emulated client hints.
Return success with data null.
If command parameters contains "userContexts":
Let user contexts be the result of trying to get valid user contexts with command parameters["userContexts"].
For each <var>user context</var> of <var>user contexts</var>:
If emulated client hints is null, remove user context from emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per user contexts.
Otherwise, set emulated client hints’s emulated client hints per user contexts[user context] to emulated client hints.
Return success with data null.
Set emulated client hints’s default emulated client hints to emulated client hints.
Return success with data null.
